Article Title: Apple event: 10 Apple products that may not be available on Apple Store
Article Text: Apple is expected to launch its iPhone 16 series at the "It’s Glowtime" event on September 9. The event will also likely see new AirPods and Apple Watch models. Older products like the iPhone 15 Pro, iPhone 14 Plus, certain Apple Watch models, and some AirPods versions are anticipated to be discontinued.
Article Summary: Apple is expected to launch its iPhone 16 series at the "It’s Glowtime" event on September 9. Older products like the iPhone 15 Pro, iPhone 14 Plus, certain Apple Watch models, and some AirPods versions are anticipated to be discontinued.

Article Title: Employee union president to Infosys: ‘will not hesitate to organize a protest’..if joining date is breached
Article Text:
What NITES President said

Infosys CEO Sahil Parekh recently assured students

Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate ( NITES ) president Harpreet Singh Saluja said that the Pune-based union will not hesitate to organize a protest in front of Infosys office if there is any breach in the joining date, reports Economic Times. According to the offer letter, the company has asked 1,000 freshers whose joining had been delayed for over two years to join on October 7, 2024.Announcing that Infosys has finally released an offer letter to 1,000 engineering graduates who had been waiting for over two years, Saluja said:“I am thrilled to announce that after relentless efforts and a formal complaint by Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES), Infosys has finally issued appointment letters to more than 1,000 (still counting) campus hires today. These young engineers, who have been waiting for nearly two years, now have a confirmed joining date of October 7, 2024. This is a huge win for NITES and all the students who stood strong in the face of uncertainty and delay,” he said and added that they won't hesitate to protest in front of the company's offices if there is a breach in joining date.”"We remain vigilant... if Infosys fails to honor this commitment and breaches the joining date, we will not hesitate to organize a protest right in front of the Infosys office," he added.The said roles are for System Engineers who were initially offered a role at the Bengaluru-headquartered company in 2022. These andiates were asked to take two pre-training sessions in 2024, with the last one being as recent as August 19. However, the joining was delayed.In a statement to news agency PTI, Parikh said "Every offer that we have given, that offer will be honored, and those individuals will join Infosys. We have adjusted some dates, but beyond that, there is no change in our approach."
Article Summary: NITES president Harpreet Singh Saluja said that the Pune-based union will not hesitate to organize a protest in front of Infosys office if there is any breach in the joining date. The said roles are for System Engineers who were initially offered a role at the Bengaluru-headquartered company in 2022.

Article Title: ‘Founder mode’ and not ‘manager mode’: Why this startup guru want tech CEOs to change the way they work
Article Text:
“Founder mode” vs “manager mode”

Steve Jobs, Jensen Huang, and others who are leading their companies in “founder mode”

Y Combinator co-founder Paul Graham has ignited a debate in Silicon Valley with a provocative essay challenging long-held beliefs about startup management. The piece, published Sunday, argues that conventional wisdom on scaling companies is fundamentally flawed and introduces the concept of "founder mode" as an alternative to traditional "manager mode."Graham's essay was inspired by a recent talk from Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky , who described how following standard advice led to "disastrous" results at his company."As Airbnb grew, well-meaning people advised him that he had to run the company in a certain way for it to scale," Graham wrote. "Their advice could be optimistically summarised as 'hire good people and give them room to do their jobs.' He followed this advice and the results were disastrous."The crux of Graham's argument is that founders are often given advice suited for professional managers, not company creators. "What they were being told was how to run a company you hadn't founded—how to run a company if you're merely a professional manager," he explained. "But this m.o. is so much less effective that to founders it feels broken."Graham contends that the standard "manager mode" approach, which emphasises delegation and avoiding micromanagement, often leads to dire consequences. "What this often means is to hire professional fakers and let them drive the company into the ground," he wrote bluntly.Instead, Graham advocates for a "founder mode" of leadership, though he admits its exact principles are still being defined. He predicts it will involve more direct engagement between CEOs and employees at all levels. "Whatever founder mode consists of, it's pretty clear that it's going to break the principle that the CEO should engage with the company only via his or her direct reports," Graham wrote. "'Skip-level' meetings will become the norm instead of a practice so unusual that there's a name for it."The essay resonates strongly with Chesky's recent comments on leadership. In a TED talk, Chesky described feeling "gaslit" by advisors and employees urging traditional management approaches. "I felt like I was going crazy," Chesky said. "Everyone was telling me to do things that felt wrong, and when I did them, they didn't work."Graham echoes this sentiment, writing, "Founders feel like they're being gaslit. VCs who haven't been founders themselves don't know how founders should run companies, and C-level execs, as a class, include some of the most skillful liars in the world." Steve Jobs , whose approach Chesky studied, is often cited as a prime example. Other notable practitioners that have been talked about are Jensen Huang of Nvidia, who reportedly maintains 60 direct reports;; Mark Zuckerberg of Meta; and Sam Altman of OpenAI.Outside the tech sector, Howard Schultz, who built Starbucks into a global powerhouse, is also mentioned as embodying this hands-on leadership style.Dan Rose, a former executive at Amazon and Meta, added to the list, noting that " Jeff Bezos and Zuckerberg were both micro-managers, deep in the details of the product and business. They never set expectations of autonomy, and they fired anyone who resisted their oversight."“Worth reading,” reacts Elon Musk , Shopify CEO and others approve of Graham’s idea of “founder mode,” while some still want to stick with “manager mode’The essay has sparked intense debate in startup circles. Serial entrepreneur Howard Lerman posted that founders were "absolutely fired up" by Graham's ideas, adding: "Building a company is all I know how to do, and all I ever want to do."Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk endorsed Graham's essay as "worth reading" on social media platform X. Shopify CEO Tobias Lütke also expressed approval of the approach.However, not everyone in the tech world is fully convinced. Jessica Lessin, founder of The Information, pointed out that even highly involved founders like Jobs relied on skilled managers such as Tim Cook to oversee crucial aspects of their businesses, suggesting a more nuanced approach might be necessary.Graham concludes his essay with a bold prediction: "Once we figure out what [founder mode] is, we'll find that a number of individual founders were already most of the way there—except that in doing what they did they were regarded by many as eccentric or worse."
Article Summary: Y Combinator co-founder Paul Graham argues that conventional wisdom on scaling companies is flawed. Graham advocates for a "founder mode" of leadership, though he admits its exact principles are still being defined. Elon Musk and Shopify CEO Tobias Lütke also expressed approval of the approach.

Article Title: Reliance Jio, Airtel and other telcos blacklist 50 companies over this reason
Article Text:
Nearly 8 lakh complaints of spam calls

Telecom access providers, like Reliance Jio Airtel and Vodafone Idea, have blacklisted over 50 companies in the last two weeks, the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India TRAI ) has said as the regulator works to crack down on spam calls and messages.It also said that the telcos disconnected more than 2.75 lakh mobile numbers and telecom resources.“These steps are expected to have a significant impact on reducing spam calls and providing relief to consumers.TRAI urges all stakeholders to comply with the directives and contribute to a cleaner and more efficient telecom ecosystem,” TRAI said.According to TRAI, more than 7.9 lakh complaints have been reported against unregistered telemarketers in the first six months of 2024.“Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has observed a significant rise in spam calls, with more than 7.9 lakh complaints reported against Unregistered Telemarketers (UTMs) in the first half of the year 2024 (January to June),” the regulator stated.Notably, on August 13, TRAI issued directions to access providers to curb promotional calls from unregistered marketers with immediate effect.“Taking this issue seriously, TRAI had issued stringent directives to all Access Providers on 13th August 2024. It has mandated Access Providers to immediately stop promotional voice calls from unregistered senders or telemarketers using SIP, PRI, or other telecom resources,” the telecom regulator said.“Any UTM found to be misusing these resources will face severe consequences, including disconnection of all telecom resources for up to two years and blacklisting,” the TRAI statement added.The regulator recently granted a one-month extension to access service providers to comply with its direction regarding the whitelisting of URLs, APKs and OTT links. TRAI had earlier asked major telecom operators in the country to regulate such messages by September 1.
Article Summary: Telecom access providers, like Reliance Jio Airtel and Vodafone Idea, have blacklisted over 50 companies in the last two weeks. More than 7.9 lakh complaints have been reported against unregistered telemarketers in the first six months of 2024.

Article Title: Google Contacts removes "Recently Added" Section, prepares "Pixel Besties" widget
Article Text: Google has announced that it is removing the "Recently Added" section from its Contacts app. This feature, which allowed users to quickly access contacts they had recently added , will be discontinued in an upcoming update.While the company has not provided a specific reason for the removal, it is likely that they are streamlining the Contacts app interface to improve user experience and focus on other features.In addition to removing the "Recently Added" section, Google is also working on a new widget called "Pixel Besties." This widget will allow users to quickly access their most frequently contacted contacts directly from their home screen. The Pixel Besties widget is expected to be available for Pixel devices in the near future.For those unaware, Pixel Besties is a new widget that Google is developing for Pixel devices. This widget will allow users to quickly access their most frequently contacted contacts directly from their home screen. It's designed to provide a convenient and time-saving way to stay connected with the people you care about most.It remains to be seen how these changes will be received by users, who may have found the "Recently Added" section to be a convenient way to access their contacts.
Article Summary: Google has announced that it is removing the "Recently Added" section from its Contacts app. This feature, which allowed users to quickly access contacts they had recently added, will be discontinued in an upcoming update. The company has not provided a specific reason for the removal, but it is likely that they are streamlining the app interface to improve user experience.

Article Title: TCS expands decade-long partnership with Google Cloud, launches new AI security products
Article Text: Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) has announced an expansion of its partnership with Google Cloud to launch two new AI-powered cybersecurity solutions aimed at strengthening enterprise cyber resilience.The new offerings include TCS Managed Detection and Response ( MDR ) and TCS Secure Cloud Foundation. Both solutions leverage Google Cloud's security capabilities and TCS's industry expertise to help businesses combat advanced threats and secure cloud environments.The TCS MDR solution, powered by the Google Security Operations platform, enables security teams to detect and respond to threats more quickly.It provides continuous security monitoring and round-the-clock response capabilities.Meanwhile, TCS Secure Cloud Foundation implements Google Cloud security solutions to enhance cloud security posture and governance across single, multi, and hybrid cloud environments. It embeds security and compliance guardrails throughout the DevSecOps lifecycle using AI, machine learning, and automation."This partnership brings together the best of capabilities, contextual knowledge, and accelerators from TCS and Google Cloud to holistically protect the digital estates of enterprise customers," said Ganesa Subramanian, VP and Global Head of TCS's Cybersecurity Business Group.TCS has already successfully deployed both solutions for several clients. For example, the Secure Cloud Foundation solution helped a global bank in Germany automate the identification and deployment of over 800 security policies to ensure regulatory compliance.The expanded partnership builds on a decade-long collaboration between TCS and Google Cloud. It will now focus on leveraging Google Cloud's AI-powered security portfolio across threat intelligence, security operations, and cloud security.Peter Bailey, VP and GM of Security Operations at Google Cloud, said the integration enables dramatic improvements in organisations' security posture and real-time threat response capabilities.
Article Summary: Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) has announced an expansion of its partnership with Google Cloud to launch two new AI-powered cybersecurity solutions. The new offerings include TCS Managed Detection and Response ( MDR ) and TCS Secure Cloud Foundation. Both solutions leverage Google Cloud's security capabilities to help businesses combat advanced threats.

Article Title: Crowdstrike Windows outage: Delta threatens to sue cybersecurity company for damages
Article Text: Following the loss incurred by Crowdstrike’s faulty update in July, which resulted in significant financial damage to shareholders and lawsuits from customers, Delta Airlines , one of the affected companies, is planning to file a class-action lawsuit against the cybersecurity firm. The airlines seeks compensation of up to $500 million from both Crowdstrike and Microsoft, as disclosed in the company’s filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) According to TechCrunch, Delta has hired high-profile attorney David Boies to represent its interests in the case against CrowdStrike. The airline alleges that the faulty update amounted to gross negligence or willful misconduct, potentially voiding contractual limits on damages typically included in enterprise software agreements.Shareholders, who owned the company shares until July 29, have also taken legal action, filing a class action lawsuit against CrowdStrike. They claim the company misled them regarding its software update procedures, raising questions about CrowdStrike's transparency and risk management practices.In response to the mounting legal challenges, CrowdStrike has enlisted the services of Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan, a prominent law firm, to defend against the expected barrage of litigation. This move underscores the seriousness of the situation and the potential financial implications for the cybersecurity company.The individual lawsuits currently being filed may eventually be consolidated into a class action suit to streamline the legal process. This could lead to a "bellwether" trial, which would serve as a benchmark for future settlements.The fallout from the software update debacle extends beyond immediate financial concerns. CrowdStrike now faces significant reputational damage, which could have long-lasting effects on its business relationships and market position in the highly competitive cybersecurity industry.
Article Summary: Delta Airlines is planning to file a class-action lawsuit against cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike. The airlines seeks compensation of up to $500 million from both Crowdstrike and Microsoft. CrowdStrike has enlisted the services of Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan, a prominent law firm, to defend against the expected barrage of litigation.

The viral clicker game centres around a Hamster who acts as the CEO of a simulated virtual crypto exchange.Players are tasked with supporting this ambitious rodent by mining coins and upgrading the exchange’s level.As a reward for their efforts, players can earn free bonuses. Mining in Hamster Kombat is simple—just tap on the Hamster icon until your energy bar is depleted.The Daily Cipher Code and Combo Card are special challenges within the game designed to reward players with even more tokens. The Daily Cipher Code is a task where players must decipher a word using Morse code. Successfully cracking the code within the 24-hour time limit can earn you 1 million coins.The Daily Combo Card is a challenge that requires players to correctly choose three cards from the game’s upgrade categories: PR & Team, Markets, Legal, Specials, and Web3. Completing this challenge can net you an additional 5 million coins. Like the Cipher Code, the Combo Card is updated daily.The Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher code for today is “WITHDRAW.” Enter the code using the Morse sheet given below and earn up to 1 million coins.▬ Long Tap● Short TapW: ● ▬ ▬I: ● ●T: ▬H: ● ● ● ●D: ▬ ● ●R: ● ▬ ●A: ● ▬W: ● ▬ ▬To activate the Daily Cipher mode, simply go to the "Exchange" tab and press the "Daily Cipher" button. Once activated, enter the daily Morse code using the following tapping patterns:

Article Title: Elon Musk questions possible arson after fire ravages historic French church; here’s his post on X
Article Text:
Church’s architectural significance

Elon Musk’s reaction on social media

Official response and investigation

Also read

In the early hours of the morning, a devastating fire severely damaged the Church of the Immaculate Conception in Saint-Omer, France. This historic 19th-century church, known for its exquisite neo-Gothic architecture, suffered extensive damage as the blaze engulfed the building, leading to the collapse of its iconic steeple and bell tower. The fire, which required the efforts of over 90 firefighters to control, has left the community in shock.Fortunately, no injuries were reported, but the loss to this architectural gem is immense.The Church of the Immaculate Conception, completed in the late 1800s, is celebrated for its neo-Gothic design, which includes soaring spires, intricate stone carvings, and stunning stained glass windows. The church has long been a symbol of Saint-Omer's rich cultural and religious heritage. Its towering steeple and bell tower were among its most distinctive features, drawing visitors and worshippers alike. The destruction of these elements marks a significant loss for both the local community and architectural enthusiasts worldwide.The news of the fire quickly spread, catching the attention of many, including tech billionaire Elon Musk. Musk, known for his active presence on social media, reacted by sharing a video of the burning church on his platform X (formerly Twitter). In his post, Musk raised the question of whether the fire could have been an act of arson, sparking widespread discussion and speculation online. His post has garnered significant attention, with many users engaging in the debate over the possible causes of the fire.Following the incident, France’s Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin expressed his condolences to the Catholics and residents of Saint-Omer, acknowledging the profound loss to the community. He assured the public that a thorough investigation is underway to determine the cause of the fire. While no official statement has been made regarding the possibility of arson, the investigation will explore all potential leads to uncover the truth behind this tragic event.The fire at the Church of the Immaculate Conception has left the residents of Saint-Omer grappling with the loss of a beloved landmark. The church has not only been a place of worship but also a cornerstone of the town's identity. In the aftermath of the fire, the local community has rallied together, expressing their grief and support for efforts to rebuild and restore the church.As the investigation continues, there is hope that the cause of the fire will be determined, allowing the community to begin the healing process. Whether the fire was a tragic accident or the result of foul play, the loss of such an important cultural and religious site is deeply felt. The future of the Church of the Immaculate Conception remains uncertain, but the resolve of the Saint-Omer community to preserve their heritage is clear.In the days to come, the focus will likely shift to recovery and rebuilding efforts, with the possibility of international support for the restoration of this historic site. The church’s significance extends beyond its religious role, representing a link to the past and a beacon of architectural beauty that has inspired many. The world will be watching closely as the investigation unfolds and as the people of Saint-Omer work to restore what has been lost.
Article Summary: A fire destroyed the Church of the Immaculate Conception in Saint-Omer, France. The 19th-century church is known for its neo-Gothic design and steeple and bell tower. Tech billionaire Elon Musk shared a video of the fire on his social media platform X (formerly Twitter) Musk raised the question of whether the fire could have been an act of arson.

Article Title: How Tinder, Bumble and other dating apps are using AI to help Gen Z ‘flirt’ online
Article Text:
AI chatbot to work like virtual ‘wingman’

Tinder and Bumble exploring AI-powered profile building tools

Online dating platforms including Tinder , Hinge , Bumble and Grindr are turning to AI to combat dating app fatigue among Gen Z users. The report noted that the move aims to bring disappointed daters back on the platforms and AI chatbots provide them personalised advice.“AI is going to help people make better connections. It’s that friend in the bar who’s helping you to ask someone out — but in the virtual context,” the Financial Times quoted Grindr chief product officer AJ Balance, as saying.These platforms are developing or testing AI chatbots and tools to act as virtual 'wingmen'.These AI tools will offer assistance to Gen Z users in crafting compelling chat-up lines, building attractive profiles and even providing feedback on flirting techniques.“The idea of a wingman talking to someone else’s wingman, maybe to see what it’d be like to go on a date or to find common areas of interest, is something that’s worth exploring,” he added.Tinder and Bumble are also exploring AI's potential. Tinder says that it aims to use AI “to support daters throughout the entire dating journey” within “the coming 12 months”.Tinder is also testing an AI profile-building tool with a limited rollout. The tool is designed to alleviate “the burden of photo selection”, which scans a user’s personal photos and selects the best images. Bumble is also developing a similar feature.Meanwhile, Hinge is developing an AI chatbot to provide feedback on user responses to profile prompts.Hinge said it is also looking to achieve its “ultimate goal” of letting user feel “like they have a personal matchmaker (driven by AI) inside the app”.
Article Summary: Tinder and Bumble exploring AI-powered profile building tools. Hinge is developing an AI chatbot to provide feedback on user responses to profile prompts. Tinder says it aims to use AI ‘to support daters throughout the entire dating journey’ within ‘the coming 12 months’

Article Title: Did Pavel Durov went under the knife? His transformation raises eyebrows
Article Text:
Pavel Durov's rise to fame

Durov's recent legal troubles

Pavel Durov’s transformation: Then vs. Now

Social media reactions on Durov’s transformation

Impact of public scrutiny

Also read

Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram , has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance. Adding to the intrigue, Durov was recently arrested in France, raising further questions about the man behind the popular messaging app.Pavel Durov, a 39-year-old entrepreneur originally from Russia, is best known as the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013.Telegram quickly gained popularity for its strong emphasis on user privacy, offering end-to-end encryption and other security features that set it apart from competitors. As of now, Forbes estimates Durov's net worth to be around $15.5 billion. Despite his success in the tech industry, Durov has managed to maintain a relatively low profile—until now.Durov's recent arrest in Paris has added a new layer of complexity to his public image. He was detained in France on charges of suspected complicity in running an online platform involved in illicit activities, including child exploitation, drug trafficking, and fraud. While these allegations are serious, it is the sudden focus on Durov's physical transformation that has captured the internet's attention.Pavel Durov has been active on social media platforms like Instagram since 2011, regularly sharing photos from his travels around the world. In his recent posts, Durov appears with a full head of hair and a toned physique, often posing shirtless in various locations. However, these recent images stand in stark contrast to older photos where Durov was seen with a noticeably receding hairline.The drastic change in his appearance has fueled rumours that Durov may have undergone plastic surgery, including a possible hair transplant. A popular post on X (formerly Twitter) by a well-known account shared a side-by-side comparison of Durov's old and new photos, sparking a flurry of online discussions. The post reads, "Pavel Durov (Telegram CEO) before his hair transplant and plastic surgery," and has since gone viral.The speculation around Durov's transformation has been met with a variety of opinions online. On Reddit, users have debated whether the changes in Durov's appearance are the result of surgical procedures or simply better grooming and styling.One Reddit user commented, "This isn't a hair transplant. His hair is too thick and full to have this kind of drastic change from a HT. Most likely he's wearing a hair system (wig)."Another user added, "There's speculation that it's not a transplant, but rather a hair system because his hair loss was much more advanced in the first picture, so when the operation happens, the resulting hairdo never looks as full as his."Some users believe the changes are the result of plastic surgery, with one theorising, "This is well-done surgery."However, not everyone is convinced that surgery is involved. One Reddit user opined, "Honestly, I think a lot of the facial 'changes' are simply due to the much better angle and lighting in the second photo."As the speculation continues, it's clear that Durov's transformation—whether natural or assisted—has caught the public's eye. The intense scrutiny of his appearance highlights the challenges that come with being in the spotlight, especially for someone as private as Durov. Whether or not he has undergone any procedures, the discussions around his looks reflect a broader societal fascination with image and success.
Article Summary: Pavel Durov, 39, is the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013. He has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance.

Article Title: This premium OnePlus gets ‘cheaper’: New price, offer and more
Article Text:
New price

OnePlus 12R spécifications

A recent online report revealed that OnePlus may soon launch its next generation flagship smartphone — OnePlus 13. However, ahead of the flagship launch, the Chinese smartphone maker has slashed the price of its premium smartphone — OnePlus 12R .Launched earlier this year, OnePlus 12R has witnessed a price cut in India making it more affordable. The smartphone comes in three variants — 8GB+128GB, 16GB+256GB and 8GB+256GB.The company has only slashed the price of the 8GB+128GB variant.OnePlus launched the OnePlus 12R in India in January this year. The 8GB+128GB version of the smartphone was price at Rs 39,999. The 128GB variant of OnePlus 12R has received a price cut of Rs 2,000 and it is now available at Rs 37,999. The smartphone can be purchased in Cool Blue, Iron Grey and Sunset Dune colour options. Customers purchasing the smartphone can avail benefits worth Rs 2,250 on JioPlus postpaid plans.The OnePlus 12R comes with a 6.78-inch AMOLED display featuring a 120Hz refresh rate and LTPO 4.0 technology. The screen supports an adaptive refresh rate and reaches a peak brightness of 4500 nits, all protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.Under the hood, the OnePlus 12R is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 octa-core chipset (4nm) and the Trinity Engine, paired with 8GB of LPDDR5X RAM and 128GB of UFS 4.0 storage. The device sports a triple rear camera setup, including a 50MP Sony IMX890 main sensor, along with ultra-wide and macro lenses, and a 16MP front-facing camera.The smartphone also includes the Cryo-Velocity Cooling System, which utilizes advanced graphite and dual vapor chambers for optimal heat dissipation. It is powered by a 5,500mAh battery with support for 100W SUPERVOOC charging, enabling a full charge in just 26 minutes.
Article Summary: The company has only slashed the price of the 8GB+128GB variant. Customers purchasing the smartphone can avail benefits worth Rs 2,250 on JioPlus postpaid plans. The smartphone can be purchased in Cool Blue, Iron Grey and Sunset Dune colour options.

Article Title: When Tesla CEO Elon Musk called Ratan Tata a “gentleman and …”
Article Text:
Tata Nano and the Indian automobile market

Elon Musk praised Ratan Tata

The legacy of the Tata Nano

Also read

In the realm of business and innovation, few figures command as much respect as Tata Group chairman emeritus Ratan Tata. His influence extends far beyond the Indian corporate world, even garnering admiration from Tesla CEO Elon Musk . In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose , Musk praised Ratan Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar." This moment has recently resurfaced, shedding light on Musk's appreciation for Ratan Tata and his ambitious project, the Tata Nano .The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time). The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. The idea was revolutionary—a small, affordable car that would cater to the vast Indian middle class, providing them with a safe and efficient means of transportation.In the interview with Charlie Rose, which took place shortly after the launch of the Tata Nano, the Tesla CEO was asked about his views on Ratan Tata’s efforts to introduce a low-cost car in India. The interview clip, which has recently gone viral, captures Musk's candid response."Take for a moment Ratan Tata, what he’s doing in India — developing a little sedan for $2300. Where do you put that in the whole equation of where the future of cars is?" asked Rose.Musk responded with a mix of admiration and caution. He began by acknowledging the brilliance behind the Tata Nano project and the character of Ratan Tata himself."I think it's a good idea to have affordable cars, but I think the problem with something like the Nano ... I wouldn't say problem because I think, by the way, it is probably a great idea and Ratan is a gentleman and scholar," Musk said.However, Musk also expressed his concerns about the long-term viability of such a low-cost vehicle, particularly in the context of rising fuel prices. He pointed out that while the initial purchase cost of the Nano was remarkably low, the cost of running the car—particularly fuel costs—could become a significant issue as gasoline prices continued to rise."But where it’s going to become challenging in the future is when the price of gasoline rises, the cost of acquiring the car is much less of an issue than the cost of running the car," the billionnaire explained.Despite the initial excitement surrounding the Tata Nano, the car faced numerous challenges. One of the most significant issues was its branding. While the Nano was intended to be an affordable vehicle for the masses, it was often labeled as "cheap" rather than "affordable." This perception problem, combined with safety concerns and competition from other small cars, led to unimpressive sales figures.The Nano’s production was ultimately discontinued in 2018, marking the end of what was initially seen as a groundbreaking project. The car's journey from inception to discontinuation is often cited as one of the biggest marketing failures in the automobile industry.
Article Summary: The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time) The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose, Musk praised Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar"

Article Title: Watch: Anand Mahindra shares video of Gujaratis doing garba in water, internet reacts
Article Text:
“Gujarat aur Garba, Ek gazab ka rishta (an amazing relationship)…Unstoppable,”

Take a look at the video here:

How X users reacted to the post



“This is how billionaires make Indian feel they are one of them: Romanticize crippled infra of the country,”

“Bro is tweeting this in his luxury 20bhk apartment,”

“It is a shame that these bunch of media fans did not know that they were dancing in gutter water and that lots of others must have life-saving issues, food needs, and medical help: this is a weird and senseless act, also insult to our dharma.”

A recent post by Tech Mahindra chairman Anand Mahindra on X (formerly known as Twitter) has sparked criticism from users. The billionaire industrialist shared a video showing people performing garba in knee-deep water in flood-affected Gujarat . While Mahindra did not mention the specific location, he commended the spirit of the people dancing amid severe waterlogging. The video comes in the wake of heavy rains in Gujarat, which have resulted in at least 47 deaths due to rain-related incidents in the region.Mahindra wrote in his X post,The post faced criticism amidst widespread infrastructure issues in India.With recent incidents of waterlogging, traffic disruptions, and electrocutions, many felt the post was insensitive to the hardships faced by people across the country. The post's positive tone contrasted sharply with the negative experiences shared by numerous social media users.Multiple X users slammed the post and pointed out how billionaires don’t have any issues with the country’s infrastructure facing challenges.a user named Harsh Vardhan wrote.another user named Siddesh Kumbhar pointed out.A third user named Nautamlal Mehta also criticised the ones that were dancing in the water. He wrote:Meanwhile, some X users also praised the video and acknowledged the group's strength in the face of adversity.
Article Summary: Anand Mahindra shared a video of people performing garba in flood-affected Gujarat. The video comes in the wake of heavy rains in Gujarat, which have resulted in at least 47 deaths due to rain-related incidents in the region. The post faced criticism amidst widespread infrastructure issues in India.

Article Title: Bengaluru-based Dunzo lays off 75% employees, reduces workforce to 50
Article Text:
Dunzo sends email to employees

Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. Citing unknown sources aware of the matter, the report said that the online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams.The job cuts , according to the report, is part of a broader effort to curb costs and create cash flow to address mounting liabilities, including overdue salaries to current and former employees and outstanding vendor payments. Layoffs .fyi - the online tracker show that the job cuts were made on August 31, 2024.As per the report, Dunzo has sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent downsizing. In the letter, Dunzo promises to pay pending salaries, severance, leave encashment, and other dues to affected staff as soon as it secures the necessary funds.Dunzo, which started as a concierge service, has undergone multiple shifts and challenges. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round. In May this year, Dunzo was reportedly close to securing $22-25 million through a mix of equity and debt from both new and existing investors.In mid-July this year, the company informed its employees that it was in the final stages of closing a deal, expecting to settle dues within 10-15 days. However, the transaction failed to materialize with subsequent emails revealing persistent delays and challenges.The company is now seeking to diversify its revenue sources beyond its primary merchant-focused operations.
Article Summary: Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce. The online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round.
